hook.text: The car salesman agreed to your price â€” then casually added a $500 documentation fee.

buildup.text: The nibble is a small request made after the main deal seems done.

discovery.text: It works because people feel committed and don't want to restart the whole deal.

twist.text: It's one of the most common tactics in retail, real estate, and corporate deals.

climax.text: The defense: smile and say 'I'll agree if you adjust the main price.'

punchline.text: Little bites after the deal add up fast.

quiz.question: What is 'the nibble' in negotiation?
options: A small ask added after the deal seems done
